answers.answer: I have diabetes. It was gestational with my last but turned into type 2 after I had her. Now im 16 weeks with my 4th. The diet isnt bad. 60 or less carbs per meal 3 meals a day and 3 snacks at 15 carbs. You can eat almost all the same stuff you eat now with minimal change. Like burgers, just take off the top part of the bun. They're are tons of tricks you can do to still eat what you're eating.

This is what they put me on:Breakfast - 15 carbsSnack -15Lunch- 45Snack -15Dinner - 60Snack - 15Threw the day my readings are 85-120 but my fasting before breakfast is 115-140 when its suppose to be below 90 and my ketones are ++ I just don't understand how its so high in the morning and my ketones....

I just got diagnosed for gestational diabetes, its a real pain and another inconvenience. I'm hoping with time I get used to it. Try speaking to a dietition or diabetes educator. It's mostly an information overload. But diabetes.org should be helpful. Picking out what to eat is my biggest challenge. Good luck!!

question: I'm 25 weeks with a boy :) but my GTT came back really high. I can't really afford the diet and so far my bls has been 120-150. Is anyone else in the same boat?
title: Gestational Diabetes anyone?
